snippet: Kenneth P. Thompson, in a letter to the departing District Attorney Charles J. Hynes, protested “a potential gross overpayment” for unused vacation to Michael F. Vecchione, who recently retired.
abstract: Incoming Brooklyn District Attorney Kenneth P Thompson, in a letter to the departing Charles J Hynes, protests possible gross overpayment for unused vacation time to retiring top deputy Michael F Vecchione; Hynes announced he was paying Vecchione almost $286,000, nearly $100,000 more than what a typical city employee would be entitled to; Thompson vows to ascertain whether fraud is involved.

byline.original: By DAVID W. CHEN and FRANCES ROBLES

lead_paragraph: Kenneth P. Thompson, in a letter to the departing District Attorney Charles J. Hynes, protested “a potential gross overpayment” for unused vacation to Michael F. Vecchione, who recently retired.

headline.main: Brooklyn’s Next Prosecutor Protests $286,000 Payment to Hynes Deputy
headline.print_headline: Brooklyn’s Next Prosecutor Protests $286,000 Payment to Hynes Deputy
